member.name: T:Jcd.Units.Enumeration`2
member.summary: The base of all DDD-style enumerations in this library.
member.typeparam: The type of the enumerated members.

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.Enumeration`2.GetAll
member.summary: Retrieves all public static properties of type on the derived enumeration
member.returns: An for all detected members.

member.name: T:Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure`1
member.summary: The interface defining what every unit of measure must support.
member.remarks: By ensuring that all units of measure provide their own type to the interface we guarantee compile time detection of certain classes of errors.

member.name: P:Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure`1.Name
member.summary: The friendly name of the unit of measure. (e.g. millisecond)

member.name: P:Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure`1.Symbol
member.summary: The symbolic short representation. NOTE: THIS SHOULD BE ONLY LETTERS AND SYMBOLS, NOT AN EQUATION.

member.name: P:Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure`1.Coefficient
member.summary: The Coefficient relative to the fundamental unit for derived units. This is 1.0 for fundamental units. This should never be 0. (divide by zero errors will occur.)

member.name: P:Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure`1.Offset
member.summary: This is the offset from the fundamental unit.

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.Quantity`1.GetHashCode
member.summary: Computes a hashcode for the quantity. So that numeric equivalence is maintained regardless of precise unit of measure is used, the hashcode is calculated on the base unit representation. TUnits is included in the hashcode to ensure that differing units do not compare the same.
member.returns: The calculated hashcode.

member.summary: Compares this instance to another instance for relative value.
member.param: The other instance to compare against.
member.returns: -1 if this instance is less than the other; 1 if this instance is greater than the other; 0 if equivalent.

member.summary: Compares this instance to another instance for relative value.

member.name: T:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasure`1
member.summary: Base type to simplify creating a unit of measure. This type provides relational and equivalence operations.
member.param: The name of this unit
The symbol or abbreviation to represent the
The unit's coefficient relative to the ultimate base unit's representation.
The offset used when computing values going to and from the base unit's representation.

member.name: T:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasureExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods that convert raw values to and from fundamental (Coefficient=1, Offset=0) unit of measure representations.

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasureExtensions.FromBaseUnitValue``1(``0,System.Double)
member.summary: Given a raw value, convert FROM the fundamental base unit representation TO the non-base value. (e.g. 0.1 becomes 100mm as meters are the base unit and 0.1m is 100mm )
member.param: The unit of measure to convert TO
the normalized value.
member.typeparam: The type of unit of measure (e.g. Length)
member.returns: The denormalized value

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasureExtensions.ToBaseUnitValue``1(``0,System.Double)
member.summary: Given a raw value, convert TO the fundamental base unit representation FROM the non-base unit representation of the value. (e.g. 100mm becomes 0.1 as meters are the base unit)
member.param: The unit of measure to convert FROM
the denormalized value.
member.typeparam: The type of unit of measure (e.g. Length)

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasureExtensions.ComputeFundamentalCoefficient``1(Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure{``0},System.Double)
member.summary: Given a and a coefficient, calculate the equivalent coefficient for the fundamental unit of measure. (i.e. the one with Coeff = 1 and Offset = 0)
member.param: The base unit of measure to use.
The coefficient to normalize.
member.returns: The coefficient for the fundamental unit of measure.

member.name: M:Jcd.Units.UnitOfMeasureExtensions.ComputeFundamentalOffset``1(Jcd.Units.IUnitOfMeasure{``0},System.Double)
member.summary: Given a and an offset, calculate the equivalent offset for the fundamental unit of measure. (i.e. the one with Coeff = 1 and Offset = 0)
member.param: The base unit of measure to use.
The offset to normalize.
member.returns: The offset for the fundamental unit of measure.
